reviewText:
While this game is quite difficult to get used to I think it has a great deal of potential. There are a few small things I would change to make this game a little less punishing.

1. Let the arrow keys move the character a bit while falling. I'm aware that gravity changes allow you to change your course, however it'd be nice to be able to rely on falling to do things and to counteract the intertia you invariably have when coming off a ledge.

2. Give a bit of leeway on the outside of the map for falling or whatever. It'd be nioce if you could extend the buffer to about 3 or 4 tiles so that going off the map isn't insta-death. If something is insta-death then use spikes instead.

3. A windowed mode?

However, it is a challenging game and I can see the fun in it.

reviewText:
Product received for free

So far a nice and challenging puzzle with some rage-quit style in some levels.

The art is great, colorful and emotional, reminds me of the old platformers of the nintendo era all combined with a very cheerful soundtrack that only adds to the nostalgia of those games.

The gameplay is somewhat creative, you control gravity and your character to move to one point to the exit (I think I already saw one game called Gravity Duck in the Amazon Store with a similar gameplay) with different types of levels and mechanics to use the gravity and some hardcore levels for the really skilled ones.

I would recommend this game but not at this original price, maybe in a bundle or with some discount, it gets pretty challenging and just watching the level design with the music feels pretty nice but can get pretty boring after a while, just a casual game for when you have nothing else to play at the moment and you want some trading cards as well.

I give 7/10

reviewText:
Challenging puzzle game with great visuals!
You are this little alien that tries to get all stars and unlock next levels by changing gravity!

When you change your character gravity it will float through air and that takes little bit of practice to get used to!

Suggestions:
Windowed mode
Controller support (least xbox controllers)
Ability to fall little bit off map and fall back again
Pros
Challenging puzzles
Good retro music
Controls takes little bit used to!
Cons
You want to play puzzles over and over again!
Will make you loose your mind if you do one simple mistake end of puzzle!
Conclusion: Challenging puzzle game with little bit hard controls

Tested on:
Hardware        Type                Motherboard        ASUSTeK P8H67              GPU        Nvidia GTX 560                OS        Windows 10 pro 64bit            CPU        Intel i5 2500K            RAM        8GB DDR3             HDD        500gb HDD                Keyboard        Logitech G510s

reviewText:
Product received for free

This game really wants to be super meat boy. Unfortunately, its far from it. Just watch the reviews: barely anyone exceeds 3 hours of play time. The game is hard and unforgiving (intentionnaly), you are given fast movement which is nice, but everything makes you want to go as slowly as possible, as your worst enemy will be the edges of the screen.
Gravity Den is colorful, but really lacks context (story, characters, special effects..).
My last negative point would be the nearly impossible achievements, moreover on the map, we cannot know in which level we completed the achievement, which is frustrating.

My final verdict would be 'Nice try, but meh'.
